title: Flight into Burlington
description: Today, I flew into Burlington after connecting in New York City. I arrived in the afternoon, and took a cab to my apartment to start unpacking!

title: First Day of Work
description: First day of work at Hack Club! I got into the office bright and early, and it was amazing to see colleagues that I only often see online. I appreciated the environment which fostered collaboration, discussion, and lots of fun.

title: First Hockey Game
description: In playing hockey for the first time, I learned about collaboration, grit, and (both metaphorically and literally) getting up after you fall down.

title: Preparation and Planning: conceptualization of the Print hackathon, and development of the Sleepover website and online system
description:
I spent my first week working on conceptualization of the hackathon we will be running with the New York Times, including working on a slide deck for pitches, website design, logistic plans for the event, and ideas for collaboration with the Times.

I also developed the entirety of the Sleepover backend and much of the front-end to handle user submission of projects for the hackathon, the shop and fulfillment system for prizes, user settings, a gallery of approved projects, and an automated system for Hack Club staff members to review projects for quality.

title: First Team Sync
description: At my first team sync, I was able to present my progress on the Sleepover website. I loved getting to be in a supportive, enthusastic work environment, and hearing about all of my coworkers' projects.

title: Design of the Print website
description: I helped cut out newspapers and arrange them digitally to design the front-end of the website (using Figma) for our journalism inspired hackathon.

title: Trip into Burlington
description: On this Sunday, I took a trip into Burlington to explore the famous Church Street Marketplace. Plus, I got some book shopping done!

title: Philanthropy and communications work
description: Today, I spent my morning working with Christina on slide decks for her zoom calls with philanthropic organizations such as the Balmer company. This experience taught me a lot about how to pitch an organization, and how to tailor your communications to the group you are meeting with and their values.

title: Execution and Iteration: testing and launch of the Sleepover website and event
description: I spent my second week, though I was mostly working from home with strep throat, working on beta testing the sleepover website. During this week, I learned from advanced developers about techniques for website, api, and data security.

title: Sleepover Launch
description: Today was the day we launched the Sleepover website! Though there was a slight snafu with some last-minute bugs, the launch went smoothly, and we had over 100 signups in our first afternoon.

title: Next Steps and Raising Awareness
description: This week, I am going to work on spreading press for Sleepover and working on forming partnerships to gain participants.
